overview.ovdesc:
The application sets up model data input for any
T24 application. This prevents repeating input that does not vary from record to record or saves standard input that is required periodically. It is associated with VERSION by means of subroutines.
The sequence of events is.
Have the administrator set up a VERSION record that will use EB.MODEL.DATA.
Start input to a new record in the application in which you want to use the automatic inputs
Key only into the fields you want filled automatically
Hold the record
Go to the EB.MODEL.DATA application and input a record indicating the application and version you will be using. Supply the record key of the record you just put on hold. When you set REFRESH.DATA to "Y" then the field names and values from the Held record will be recorded the EB.MODEL.DATA record.
Authorise the EB.MODEL.DATA record.
You can now Delete the Held record.
The automatic input from the EB.MODEL.DATA record will be applied when you input a new record to the application via the VERSION.
There are two routines that can be attached to a VERSION to incorporate data. One uses the data it finds in the EB.MODEL.DATA with the same ID as the VERSION. The other routine prompts the user for the name of an EB.MODEL.DATA record containing the input.
